result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry J Brookshire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT:  
The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, and surcharges, excluding a DNA assessment.  Court waived the DNA surcharges on motion of defense.  Defendant may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinment are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can them proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.

* August 9, 2021/Judge David Feiss: Court ordered Defendant IS ELIGIBLE IMMEDIATELY FOR THE WISCONSIN SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAM.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT with Counts 2 & 3 and any other sentence. Court orders a total of 682 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victim, Antonio H or the co-defendant Melissa C.
Any other conditions to be set by the Department of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: Conditions the same on all Counts.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CONCURRENT with Counts 1 & 3 and any other sentence.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CONCURRENT with Counts 1 & 2 and any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry J Brookshire

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Petition for Sentence Adjustment.  (Henry J. Brookshire - #426053, Oakhill Correctional Institution, PO Box 938, Oregon WI 53575).
-received and filed.

Defendant Henry J Brookshire in Court with Attorney Brian Patrick Mullins.  Defendant Henry J Brookshire in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Decision hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Arguments heard. 
Court found the trial court and trial counsel were in error regarding Defendant's eligibility for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
Based on the error, Court found it was appropriate to MODIFY Defendant's Sentence. 
For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered Defendant IS ELIGIBLE IMMEDIATELY FOR THE WISCONSIN SUBSTANCE ABUSE PROGRAM. 

Court held colloquy with Defendant. Court found the Defendant knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily WAIVED any other appellate issues.  
Court VACATED Motion hearing date of September 28, 2021. 

Case forwarded to the Clerk's Office for processing.

Clerk contacted the necessary parties in the DA's Office to CANCEL ORDER TO PRODUCE.
Mr. Brookshire requested to appear via Zoom Video Conference for Motion hearing scheduled August 9, 2021 at 03:00 pm.
ADA Flaherty and Attorney Mullins will appear IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Clerk contacted Oakhill/Oregon Correctional Institution via email to make arrangements for Mr. Brookshire. 

Hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a2c51eb2-8d2b-766b-a132-aa68081ac004

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Henry J Brookshire in court with attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo.  Defendant Henry J Brookshire in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has satisfied victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional Statements by:  Trevor B, Frederick B, and Alvin J

As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  15 YEARS CONCURRENT with Counts 2 & 3 ; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 10 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.
As to Count 2:   The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  15 YEARS CONCURRENT with Counts 1 & 3 ; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 10 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.
As to Count 3:   The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  10 YEARS CONCURRENT with Counts 1 & 2 ; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.
These sentences are CONCURRENT to any other sentences.
Court orders a total of 682 days credit
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No contact with the victim, Antonio H or the co-defendant Melissa C
- any other conditions to be set by the Department of Corrections

The Court is imposing the applicable fees, assessments, court costs, and surcharges, excluding a DNA assessment.  Court waived the DNA surcharges on motion of defense.  Defendant may have to give a swab, which you might be able to have expunged under 165.77.
The Court orders the DOC to collect any monetary amounts ordered today at the rate of max 25% of any amounts provided in secs 973.05(4)(b) and 973.20 while the defendant is in their control.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the defendant is released from confinment are to be paid as a condition of the extended supervision.  Any monetary amounts that remain unpaid when the sentence is completed are ordered reduced to a judgment against the defendant for the unpaid balance and collection can them proceed under sec. 71.935 as well as other collection procedures.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armour.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.

Attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court, defendant Henry J Brookshire not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This is a 2014 case and a PSI was requested on the last court date.  State withdraws request as no PSI was ordered. Defense would not like to prolong this case and does not request that a PSI be done at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 7. Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Henry J Brookshire not in court, in custody not produced.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.    Case adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 08:30 am.
MOTION FOR NEW TRIAL.

Attorney Russell J. A. Jones in court, defendant Henry J Brookshire not in court, in custody not produced.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant needs to be produced before defense counsel is allowed to withdraw.  Case adjourned for further proceedings.  Further proceedings scheduled for 06-10-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:02 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Regan and Urbaniak who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Henry J Brookshire in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Henry J Brookshire in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Timothy Keller and John McCormack., Exhibits 90, 91-97, 31,35-38, 32, 41, 53, 87 received. State and defense rest.  Defense moves to dismiss directed verdict and the state opposes.  Court denies defense motion.

At the hour of 4:49 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of Guilty as to all three counts which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
